reviewText: Let's skip past the howdy-doos and the pretentious intros. I really like this game. It's unapogetically generic, addictive, and smartly-designed. Major Mayhem is a game that truly feels like it was focus-tested for maximum enjoyment. When it comes to games, you'll sometimes read descriptions like It's not for everyone". This game
date: is for everyone. Whether you're the type that likes to unlock stuff and get cash
recommended: somebody who just wants to shoot and/or blow stuff up
hoursPlayed: or even a person who shoots for the high-scores
voteText: Major Mayhem is the game for you.\n\nEhh...I feel dirty all of a sudden. These days Android/IOS can be regarded as a legitimate gaming platform
helpfulPercent: but I'm an old codger and can't grasp/don't like cell-phone games. So to recommend something as shameless as Major Mayhem
commentsCount: that sort of thing. So I'm going to break down what I like about this game.\n\n-Mission objectives are smartly-designed. There's always an incentive to change weapons
column17: and collect cash. This game knows exactly which elements of your brain to massage
column18: so you're compelled to keep playing.\n-Different weapons have different scoring strategies. With a shotgun you'll want to aim for enemies that crowd together. Sniper rifles can pierce objects
column19: and there are bonus points for killing enemies behind cover. If you want to unlock everything you're going to try each weapon
column20: thus you'll devise your own personal best scoring weapon.\n-Enemy corpses can be shot for bonus points.\n-Mechanics are extremely solid. When it comes to gun games
column21: there's nothing more frustrating than poor mechanics. When I aim at an enemy's forehead
column22: I don't want the bullet to fly into their arm
column23: and I want appropriate feedback. While the enemies in this game resemble toys more than human beings
column24: they still react properly to every shot. The sound-direction and visual feedback is on-point as well. Altogether it's pretty satisfying.\n-Nice amount of depth to the scoring system. High scores aren't achieved just by shooting everyone. Everything from maintaining a combo
column25: to using an item at the right moment
column26: to getting those trick shot bonuses
column27: are essential tactics.\n\nWhen a company name-drops Metal Slug and Time Crisis I get this "Whoa...really?" look on my face. I expect their game to deliver something of comparable quality. While I won't say Major Mayhem hits those highs
column28:
it gets so much right that I gotta give respect.

Well worth my time and possibly yours.

reviewText:
This is the game Rambo The Video Game should've been. A game with lovely graphics and solid and plenty of gameplay.
Yes, it may be a port from the mobile phones but it definitely fits our system. You'll be able to shoot enemies with precision and that's what matters most in a game like this. The one thing that didn't impress me is the fact that you earn coins rather slowly. So you'll be replaying levels over and over just to be able to buy those new outfits and weapons. If you play on a platform where you have this sort of precision you want to keep players occupied as much as you can. Replaying levels is fun but not if it takes tens of times to earn the amount of coins you need. Thankfully, there are challenges that help speed things up but after about 50 challenges (of the 150) you start noticing that this also needs a lot of replaying already finished levels.

In the end it's still twenty times better than Rambo, and even if that's not a fair comparison you still need to play this.

[Rating: 77/100]

reviewText: Casual doesn't even begin to describe this literal smartphone game, but it does have that quality that we both hate and love smartphone games for: Brainless gameplay. The Major's adventures won't be putting your brain or even your reflexes to much of a test, but sometimes that's the only sort of game you have the time or energy for. For those occasions, Major Mayhem fits in quite nicely. And with lots of game modes and tons of stuff to collect, it has the potential to fill that niche for quite some time.

reviewText:
Best rail shooter for PC yet.
This review is based mostly on my play time with the Shiny Loot (DRM-free + Steam key) version. So, my Steam stats don't reflect my actual play time with Major Mayhem.

PROS:
+ FUN!
+ Easy to pick up, difficult to master.
+ Tons of unlockables.
+ Cheap at only $5 (USD). FREE for iOS, Android, Windows phones, and Kindle Fire.
+ LOW hardware requirements.
+ Cross-platform; Windows/Mac/Linux compatible.
+ Fun graphics are easy on the eyes and not intimidating to casual players.

CONS:
- No online multiplayer, yet.
- Hardcore" gamers may be put off by Major Mayhem's 'accessibility'."
voteText: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I wasn't expecting Major Mayhem to be anything good, since from all I know, it was a shooter designed for mobile devices with touch screen. Turns out I was wrong, Major Mayhem handles pretty great with your mouse, which you use to aim, shoot and activate several powerups.

Overall Major Mayhem presents you with a pretty simple, if not poor, storyline and some really neat looking graphics. The game is pretty much a simple aim and shoot game and you ocasionally take cover. By killing enemies and getting higher combos you get more points and more coins, which you can then spend on clothes and unlock weapons. The soundtrack was actually pretty  great to listen to while playing. The enemy variety is rather lacking and the same goes for bosses.

In the end Major Mayhem will end up being enough for some people and not enough for others, it certainly is nothing to be amazed by but it can provide you a few hours of fun with the various modes it has (Campaign, Arcade, Time Bomb and Survival).

reviewText: Major Mayhem is a rail shooter with a story and a lot of customization options but is it a rail shooter you will want to play ? In Major Mayhem you play as the major. Hes assing to kill some terrorist that kidnapped his girlfriend and thats all there is to the story. But how is this game ? Its actually quite fun. All you do in this game is go to cover from cover and fight bad guys there are the some boss fights that are really fun. The game acts on a three hit system. Three hits and youre dead. Its also a very easy and short game. It has a lot of bonus objectives that you need to complete to get new guns and more money for power ups and outfits for youre charecter. Like every game it also has its problems. The hit detection isnt always the best sometimes when you shoot somebody it doesnt really hit them and sometimes enemies can shoot you through walls which is annoying. The scoring system works when it wants to. Overall a really good game and a fun little title to pick. Its cheap fun i give Major Mayhem an 8/10

reviewText:
This indie arcade third person shooter is a blast to play.
The game has over 5,000,000+ downloads on the Google Play Store and having a rating of 4.8 and with that many downloads tells you this game is worth a serious look...
I have it on Android for my phone and tablet, it's one of my favorites, so buying it to play on my PC and laptop was an easy decision to make.
If you have an Android phone or tablet try this game out on the Google Play Store and see it for yourself (it's free), then imagine using a mouse to target all the bad guys. Your mouse is the Aim, button 1 is shoot, button 2 is jump and #1 thru #4 are the extra weapons. You can also change the control configuration to what you like. The resolution is adjustable to your monitors resolution, it will full screen or window mode too.
With my experience with this game on Android, using a mouse for the aim made the game a whole lot more enjoyable on the PC and less frustrating in heavy combat fighting.

It's on sell right now for $1 off 20% - $3.99, but the regular price of $4.99 is a bargin for the amount of replay value this little game offers. There's 100 achievements to obtain in the game with 45 levels, so you're not going to play it just once.
You earn coins in the game by killing enemies and completing tasks, you use the coins to buy Supplies, missles, armour, slow time, super bullets and unlock levels. You can also buy various outfits for the Major to wear in the game. Different weapons (guns) are earned by ranking up through game play. So you're going to be playing this game quite a few times to earn enough coins to be able to purchase all the items in the game.
It's a great time killer when you don't have the time to get involved in regular size games, jump right in and play a few missions till it's time to do what you're waiting to do. We all need a game to kill time with and this is one of the best I've ever played to kill time with. Although it is hard to stop playing once you've started because it is that good.

Don't miss out on Major Mayhem it's a great little shooter with alot of replay value and it's a great bargin for what you get, 45 levels of nonstop third person shooter fun with 100 achievements...
voteText: 11 of 20 people (55%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Major Mayhem is a simple but nonetheless entertaining casual shooter.  The intricate pretext: The world is in total mayhem and they got your girl.

This sidesrolling railshooter combines simplistic gameplay with some weapon progression and tongue in cheek character customization. Lots of references and recognizable outfits, a fun setting and a clean style.
Obivously this was made for mobile devices so it has some of those made for touchscreen elements like the huge onscreen pause button.
When advancing in level your character can spin the reward wheel and unlocks gear and stuff in the armory. Some of these have certain level requirements so it keeps you going til u get that new shotgun or whatever.

Absolute no brainer, cute style and low price... count me in!
voteText: 23 of 44 people (52%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The gameplay in Major Mayhem involves your character running to cover and then you use the mouse to shoot enemies with a variety of weapons when they pop up. It's a simple premise, but a great game to play when you've got a few minutes here and there. It's a mobile port, but unlike many ports I've played the interface and controls work great.

The game is a little short, but still long enough to be worth the $5 it costs, and it has a few other game modes and a ton of achievements (that involve a lot of grinding) to keep you coming back.

Finally, I noticed a couple of typos while playing last night and sent a message to the Major Mayhem Facebook page. I received a response before I woke up this morning saying they'll be fixing those in the next update. Great customer service!

I managed to get a copy of the game in a bundle for less than the $5 asked here, but I enjoyed it enough that I bought an extra copy at full price to give away to a friend. You should probably check this game out!

reviewText:
What is a.... Major Mayhem?

It's a rail-shooter, where you play a Major Mayhem (he is more like a Rambo) . Remember House of the Dead series? You don't have much of the control of the game apart from aiming , shooting and jumping in specific moments.

#####iOS PORT#####
This is an iOS port, this means game was DESIGNED for smartphones.

As you know, porting games is poor due to Developers choice, you can see a good example of it: Deus Ex  The Fall.
This game is far from it but still, as much as I like cartoony graphic... I wish I could simply disable tutorials and achievements.

I never played this game on my smartphone, because I use my smartphone for other stuff.

#####Gameplay#####
Game gets quickly boring due to repetitive-similar looking levels. After 30 minutes, you'll realize that this game is just boring (at least I do, I'm a big boy).

After 5 levels you'll realize how slow the progression is, you'll need to grind a lot to get a good stuff (iOS offered in-app purchases, blame that)

You can quickly unlock other modes or other locations by spending Gold Coins (you earn them by doing Objectives). That's soooooo boring.

#####Music#####
Throw the music away and play your own. Not good.

#####CONS#####
I'm not a fan of smartphone games. I've got a chance to play few and I disliked them by these few simple reasons:
1. Forced Tutorial
2. Tons of crappy objectives/achievements (Jump 5 times / Kill 1 opponent / Grab Armor...etc)
3. Lack of options to disable Features"
4. Grinding and grinding.
5. Game is GLITCHY
6. Not optimized to PC players (ex: escape does not resume your game)

Not worth to buy UNLESS you have Kids who don't have anything to play.
Not worth full price."

reviewText: Major Mayhem is one of the best titles that has started out as a mobile-only game. It has made a rather smooth transition from mobile to PC gaming and fans of Metal Slug will find it both tame yet enjoyable. The missions are slightly challenging and there is enough content to keep one busy for quite a while to come, although the game is best played in small doses once the campaign is completed.\n\nThere are multiple modes to keep gamers coming back for more, such as Survival, Timebomb and Arcade; however repeating the same areas and missions wears thin after a while. Highly worth the $4.99 spent if you're a fan of arcade style shooters, if you're in doubt check out the free version on your phone first!

reviewText:
This is one of those much-maligned mobile ports, but in this case I think PC gamers got the better deal.  This plays so well with a mouse that the thought of playing it with a touchscreen baffles me.  It does, however, suffer from some of the usual port problems and occasional bugs, though I am happy to forgive those here.  It also chooses not to explain what its various game modes are and how they work, for some reason.

In terms of gameplay, this is enormous fun and surprisingly clever.  It just feels so satisfying to play; it's addictive and has plenty of levels to replay and achievements to unlock.  I really like the way that most enemy projectiles don't hurt, and those that do give you just enough warning for quick and clever dodges.  You can even deflect them if you're quick!  It all makes you feel like you're in a dumb action movie, in the best way possible.

Thematically this falls square into the category of the traditional 'hur hur 'murica' joke, complete with cigar-chomping commando and 'ironic' racism.  I think that's a little tired now, and probably doesn't stand up to deeper scrutiny, but to be fair it does mix it up a bit in later levels.  I'd like the game better if it had a different theme, maybe, but it's hard not to love it anyway!

reviewText:
I think it's pretty casual fun. A whole pile of 30-60 second levels of mindless point and click rail-shooting is paced well and doesn't feel tired. A large number of weapon and costume unlocks give a use for the many tons of gold spewed gratuitously.

This is a port of a free-to-play mobile game with all the purchases and restrictions stripped away. It feels and looks like you'd expect, and doesn't really change the formula in any sense.

The game has its own unique art style and represents itself well, with bright colors and excessively large explosions at every opportune moment. Pink camo costumes and tiger fur helmets add nothing to the gameplay, but neither did gold paint in COD.

I didn't feel like this really pushed any boundaries or did incredible new things, but it's a solid port of a casual mobile game following a very typical and casual formula, like pop music.

Major Mayhem gets 3 Miley Cyruseses out of 5

If you're looking for interesting games or examples of great game design, look elsewhere. This is not to say that the game is bad, but it's very generic and by the book". reviewText:
Wax on... Wax off... Kill d Ninjas!!

This is a fun arcade type game.  It's a point and click shooter.  Side scrolling with a bit of platforming.  I believe it originally was meant for tablets and phones but it's just as good on PC.

Arcade style shooter.  I would compare it a bit to duck hunter for the NES but of course duck hunter 30 years later with some pretty fun and addictive game play.

In the game you kill the ninjas.  You start out with a pistol but as you rank up you can get get all sorts of armaments in the armorary.  You can also customize your Mayhem's character -- I bought the pink camo helmet just because I'm cool like that.

The levels are fast which makes this game great if you just have a little bit of time and want to have some fun ... but be warned, it's one of those addictive, just one more..." games.

It's a simple enough concept executed amazingly.  I have no problems recommending this game."

voteText: 42 of 88 people (48%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you haven't yet played 'Major Mayhem' on your favorite portable entertainment square, you've been missing out on one of the most enjoyable run & gun, twitchy arcade shooters around.  Wave after wave of stereotypes descend on you as you pick them off with one of multitude of firearms ranging from pistols, to sniper rifles, to bazookas.

It's a very simple game on the surface, but it mixes things up enough between each wave to keep it prepetually entertaining.

The touch screen controls of this mobile port have translated quite well to a mouse cursor interface.  Additonally, there's been a transition from the entirely optional in-app-purchases on mobile to a tiered unlock as you progress.

We don't see a lot of well-done arcade action like this nowadays.  Can't recommend this one enough.

reviewText: it's a fun, casual, on rails shooter, with game mechanics that are easy to get into. the achievements for this game are tough tho, and should provide decent motivation for people to invest their time to it. it's great for playing in short bursts, although don't be surprised if you end up spending more time on it than you planned. I have spent hours on this on my cellphone, and recently on desura, and it doesn't get old and is still plenty fun. strongly recommended.\n\nmy score: 7.5/10

reviewText:
Fun, quirky arcade-style shooter. It's a fun game.
A little repetative, but after you hit your stride, you'll see that repeating levels is not so bad.
Lots of weapons, lots of challenges, lots of weird clothing options....
Excellent time killer since you can pick any stage that you want once you beat it.
Get it if you:
- Like twitchy games
- Like old school arcade shooters
- Like to see Colonel Sanders with a chicken for a hat using a bazooka that shoots out chickens at tanks.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Epic storyline, intense strategy, and mind-numbing puzzles.

Things that Major Mayhem isn't about. But that's okay! Because you need a game to just play to relax. Major Mayhem is simple. It fulfills a necessary place in my brain. Sometimes, I just want to play a game that doesn't force me to think too much. I just want to have fun.

Like Time Crisis or Virtua Cop or any other first-person light gun game, you are a person on rails who shoots first, ask questions while shooting, and then shoot some more.

This game was built for the mobile device. But it's still a fantastic PC game.

reviewText:
Major Mayhem is a mobile game,keep this in mind if you are even thinking about buying it,But this is a mobile game that had care put into its pc verison at least a bit because this pc port has none of the micro payments that could of ruined the moblie version for somepeople. Instead its a onetime payment of 5 dollers and then you can gain all the Outfits and guns the game has to offer. As you level up you unlock guns and as you play you gain coins,you can guns one by one as you level up but you can buy what ever outfits you want with the money you earn they are all avalible from the word go,just some are alot more money then others.
This game is a railshooter in the style of time crysis you are in cover untill you shoot then you can get hit by red bullets,but luckly in this game you can shoot those out of the sky.

The games story is almost not there,you are major mayhem and have a mission of saving the free world and saving your girlfriend. It has 3 zones that have around 4 enemy types across them all. The game can take a few hours to beat but would take alot longer to unlock all the guns and outfits the game has to offer.

It might be a rail shooter but at only 5 dollers its not that bad of a deal,with rambo the video game being one of the only other railshooters you can choose from this might be one of the only choices people on steam have when it comes to rail shooters. Its no time crysis or house of the dead but its not bad.

reviewText: What a great little on rails shooter! Once you start blasting those baddies it's damn hard to put down! It's just a lot of fun getting coins for upgrades and acquiring the new armour, weapons and outfits! The graphics  and sound are pretty good and suit the gameplay. Also, the achievements are pretty diffciult but been fun to obtain so far. And if you tire of the Classic game mode, there are plenty of variety in the Timed, Arcade and Survuval modes! My only gripe is it would seem the game could be a bit of a grind due to the amount of things to buy and the rate you obtain them at. That aside, it's great fun and I can see myself putting in a lot of hours on this one. Deffo wortha look.

reviewText: A really well made Time Crisis-esque arcade shooter. Lots of content, very polished graphics and presentation, quite addictive, even for someone who's not a big fan of the genre. If you're interested in side scrolling shooters, this is a pretty worthwhile purchase for sure. Lacks a bit of depth and challenge though, in my personal opinion. Major Mayhem is definitely more for people looking to get into the genre, or just anyone who wants a casual pick up and play game.\n\n7/10
